transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Good evening, I am Lokar, potentate of thug locusts, bringing you a very special glimpse at an historic episode of Space Ghost, Coast to Coast. Not many people know that in the early stages of this programme, there was a contract dispute, in which the outcome was the last-minute hiring of sub-standard Earth hero Birdman. I will be showing you many clips and out-takes from this fiasco tonight. I present to you now, the r-r-remains of Birdman, Coast to Coast. Enjoy!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: What if I have to go to the bathroom during the interview?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Relax, Harv, you'll be fine. Hey, stop worryin'. Now, I'd like you to meet the show's director, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Moltar, good to have ya aboard.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well it's this, or back to solitary.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Harvey, this is Lokar, he'll be your band leader.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I prefer "musical ar-r-r-ranger", if you don't mind? Any upright anthropomorph with an appendage or two can "tickle the ivories". (plays a classical piano excerpt) Anywho, it's a delight to meet you, Birdman, charmed, I'm sure.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: What's with this guy, is he gonna do this on the show?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uhhh, I gotta question.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, babe, shoot.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Um, just exactly, um... What do I do?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: I told you, you just push the lever up and down, okay?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Up, down... (pushes lever up and down, control room monitor shows off-screen shot of Avenger) Up, down... (pushes lever up and down, monitor shows Lokar in keyboard pod) Down... (pushes lever) Wait a minute!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Uh, a little help up here.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (flies down from above, lands on stage; speaks nervously) Um, good evening, um, welcome to the show, I'm, er, your host, uh.. (echo effect) Biiiiiiird Maaaaaaan! (camera lens cracks, woman screams) Do I have to pay for that?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Good evening everyone, um, I'm your show, Birdman... hey, I'm sorry, sorry.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: I just flew in from the coast, and, and, and boy, are my arms... oh, wings, you wanted wings there? I mean, wings..

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Okay, okay, okay, okay. Eh, we do it again?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Um, well... Hey, have you heard about this, grunge rock music the kids are into? It's, um, pretty weird...

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Yippity yappity yappity! My good man, what are you going on about?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Um, I'm trying to do my opening monologue.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Opening monologue? It sounded more like you were delivering a eulogy! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Avenger
transcript.dialogue: (squawks)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (whispers) Should I start now?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Howdy, folks, let's say hello to our director, uh...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: My faithful sidekick, Avenger.

transcript.speaker: Avenger
transcript.dialogue: (bows, then squawks)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: And our band leader...

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Musical di-r-r-rector, Lokar! Observe! (plays something classical on keyboard)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (sighs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (off camera) You're pathetic, Lokar.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: What was that?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: What was that?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Well, that's Zorak...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hello.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: He's our backup bug, you know, in case somethin' happens to Liberace here?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I wish my br-r-r-other George was here!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'm stupid!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, just pick up where you left off, Harv, it'll work, just fine.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Um, tonight's guests are, um... Who are the guests, anyway?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ice and Tower, American Gladiators.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Is that it? Oh well, ladies and gentlemen, tonight's guests, Tower and Ice.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Harvey?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Well, what are you waiting for, say something.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: I will, just gimme a second. (pause) What should I say?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Anything you like, just, uh, just wing it. okay, Harv?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Ohhhhh, the pressure!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Um, welcome, Ice and Tower, it's, it's great to have you here.

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Ummmm...

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: How are you doin'? I mean, are you...

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Well, not so great, actually, I've got my entire life riding on this show, and if it doesn't work out, it probably means the end of my marriage and my career.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, my, gape at me, I'm the pitiful tr-ragic Birdman. I flit about in total depression! Oh, poor pitiful me! My world is an irventine pile!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Okay, that's enough. I can't work with this bug. He's getting on my nerves, and I don't understand a thing he says anyways.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Harvey, Harvey, calm down. Just do the show, okay?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, okay.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: My hatred for you... is delicious.

transcript.speaker: Avenger
transcript.dialogue: (squawks and squawks, in background)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: So, what's your position, uh, on this grunge music?

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: I'd have to say my favorite event is the joust, um, it's a great feeling...

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I say, can't you do anything to squelch the cacophonous squawking of your mite-ridden cohort?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Speak English, sissy.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Might I suggest that the beast may provide more entertainment value if I lop its shrieking head off!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: That's it! Avenger, ho!

transcript.speaker: Avenger
transcript.dialogue: (streaks across stage toward Lokar, beats the living bejeebers out of him)

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry... But seeing that again... Oh, please! Oh, please, go away!

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: And now, the conclusion of Birdman Coast to Coast. And Mother, stop the VCR, your Sonny Boy's not in this part.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in keyboard pod, plays "Chopsticks") (to Moltar) Lokar's in the hospital. (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: So, what's it like being a Gladiator?

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: It's, uh, it's a lifestyle that's a lot of fun, being Gladiator and superhero among kids.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: You actually consider yourselves superheroes?

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Hah! You fight mere mortals. Superheroes fight villains, evil villains.

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: Actually, I do think we fight evil villains, don't we?

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: Well, we got some people, yeah, they're pretty doggone evil, I'll tell you that.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, right. Look out for Ted, the volunteer fireman. Woooo!

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: Are you challenging us?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Sounds like a challenge to me!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Listen, Zorak, don't make me angry. You wouldn't like me when I'm angry.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I don't like you now.

transcript.speaker: Tower & Ice
transcript.dialogue: (laugh)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Can't I get any respect around here? On my own show?

transcript.speaker: Tower & Ice
transcript.dialogue: No, probably not

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: I demand respect, I'm Birdman! (echo effect) Biiiiiird Maaaaaan!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, whatever.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Ooooh, I hate you, I hate you all! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: Now, if he was a Gladiator, what would we call him? Like, Creampuff or something? (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That's rich!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (flies back) I heard that!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Harvey! Harvey, pull yourself together! It's gettin' late here, man.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Okay, okay, get off my back! (Holy Ra! Sun's going down! Must finish interview before my secret is revealed!)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Harvey, while we're young, alright?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Um, okay. Y'know, my wife always wants me to do things around the house, like move stuff, y'know, open the pickle jar.

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: The pickle jar? (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: The pickle jar.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Do you have that problem?

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: You know, this is what I tell people, a lot of people want me to open jars, help them move. These muscles are for show. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (dozes off for a second)

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: Later, not! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: These things really don't work! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Actually, my wife is thinking of leaving me.

transcript.speaker: Tower & Ice
transcript.dialogue: (laugh)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: I'm serious.

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: Imagine about twenty thousand people watching you...

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (nodding off as she speaks)

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: And it's very dark on the floor, and you can't see anything in front of you, and I tripped on a mat! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (asleep at his desk)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Birdman!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (wakes up) Uh, here, here.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Harvey, you all right?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Uh, wha? Oh, um, sorry, uh, low blood sugar.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Hey, can, can we get a peon to bring this loser some coffee?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Creeeeam Puff!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: What do you mean you can't do this show at night?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (struggling to stay away) Without.. sun's.. rays.. Birdman.. loses.. energy.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: You gotta be kiddin' me! Falcon 7 didn't say anything about this!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Wait.. 'til.. morning.. Birdman.. be.. fine. (drops head on desk, falls asleep)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, thanks for coming, guys. Say good night, Birdman.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (mumbles in his sleep) Uh, goodnight, Bird... man.

transcript.speaker: Ice
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Goodnight...

transcript.speaker: Tower
transcript.dialogue: Cream puff. (both laugh)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I guess it's past his bedtime.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Let's cook him. I bet he tastes like chicken. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (talking in his sleep) I'll be good...

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Harvey!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (wakes up) Uh, oh, uh, are we done?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: No, Harvey, but you are.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Birdman, YOU'RE FIRED!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Look, you can't do this to me. I need this job! I'll do anything! I'll get a sunlamp, you don't understand, you can't fire me, I'm the Birdman!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The Birdman?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: The Birdman's alright, he's okay! Don't you know who you're dealing with here? The Birdman, the Birdman! Biiiiird Maan! (collapses on his desk, sobs, then falls asleep again)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So, I guess we're cancelled, right?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, good news, everyone! I just got off the phone with Tad Ghostal's agent, and everything's copacetic. Tomorrow, we start shooting "Space Ghost Coast to Coast". How about that, gang?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (screams)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (screams)

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: And so, Birdman's tears flowed on and on. A little birdie told me he's now selling tent campers in Indiana. 'Tis true! I hear that if you say that Avenger sent you, the propane tanks are free! Good night, all! Kiss kiss!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: (very tired voice) Biiiiird Maaaaan.... (head hits the desk)
